New Records: This marks the Braves’ sixth consecutive NL East crown.
Atlanta improves to 96-50 on the season — the best record in the majors.
Spencer Strider achieved his majors-leading 17th win.
The Braves clinched in their 146th game, the second-earliest date for the Braves to clinch since the divisional era began in 1969.
Key Match Events: The Braves won Wednesday’s series finale at Citizens Bank Park behind a seven-inning, nine-strikeout outing by Spencer Strider and a two-run homer from Austin Riley.
Riley hit a two-run homer in the first inning and added a sacrifice fly in the third.
Kevin Pillar added an RBI double in the fourth.
The Phillies got a run in the first inning after Strider walked two of the first three batters and Bryston Stott hit a two-out single.
Strider retired the next nine batters and 19 of the last 22 that he faced.
Post-Match Reflections: The Phillies haven’t been in the division race since May, so this was a mere formality from where they stand.
The Phillies play better at Citizens Bank Park and believe there is a real advantage to having that first series here.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Braves would have to win a division series and NLCS before they could try to win a second World Series title in three years.
The Braves are on pace to finish with 106 wins, which would tie the 1998 Braves for the most wins in the franchise’s nearly 150-year history.
